Key Match Events: Kyle Higashioka's solo homer started a five-run rally against an ailing Max Fried with two outs in the second inning
Manny Machado added a two-run double with the bases loaded
Jackson Merrill followed with a two-run triple
Jorge Soler hit a solo homer in the fifth
Michael Harris II had a two-run shot in the eighth
Post-Match Reflections: This team's always shown the ability to be resilient and never quit, said Higashioka

Padres manager Mike Shildt said, 'Fortunately, we had the lead. His leaving with two outs in the fourth was a challenge, but we found solutions and the bullpen was rested and played its part to bring it home.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The sellout crowd of 47,705 — the largest in Petco Park history — roared
Robert Suarez pitched a perfect ninth for the save
Padres catcher Kyle Higashioka became the first Padres catcher to homer in consecutive playoff games
San Diego eliminated the 111-win Dodgers in a 2022 NLDS
Others: Fried and Padres starter Joe Musgrove exited early with injuries
Musgrove fell behind 1-0 after just three batters
Marcell Ozuna’s sacrifice fly brought in Harris, who doubled into the right-field corner on Musgrove’s first pitch and advanced on Ozzie Albies’ groundout
Soler homered to straightaway center leading off the fifth against reliever Bryan Hoeing

Braves manager Brian Snitker said, 'I’m about as proud of a team as I’ve ever had. We won 89 games. It’s amazing what they did. We had a chance. We got in the tournament. Maybe if we get a hit here or there, we are playing tomorrow. But we aren’t.'
